column5: Did the Thanksgiving Day dinner yesterday, my wife and mother in law have been out shopping for 6 1/2 hours so far today.  I can't imagine the damage that has been done to the bank account.  I decorated a big Pine tree in the back yard.  The boys (two of them) made some bird feeding christmas tree decorations yesterday, I had the job of hanging them and lighting the 20' Pine tree.  I used over 10 strands of LED's on the bad boy.  Can't wait for dark.  Need Beer...  Thanks for the well wishes, catch y'all soon.

swordfish, i have no beef with america(ns) however, "here's to manifest destiny" is going a little far donchya think?  manifest destiny is the belief that the US was destined to expand across the entire north american continent.  as a proud and sovereign canadian; the idea of manifest destiny is disagreeable to say the least.  we can ask the native american population what they think of manifest destiny as well.  anyhoo.. hope everyone south of the border is recovering from their food hangover.

BURP........  Excuse me....  GREAT turkey feast yesterday.......and I got to spend a few days hunting with my older boy as he is home from the US Air Force until Saturday.....we got 6 whitetails in our group with my son, nephew and I each getting one....the freezer is FULL right now....might have to put off fishing in Ontario until we eat some of the venison to make room for some fresh fish...  Merry Christmas Everyone, Bob
Hope you all have a great day. Eat well and relax with family and friends.
Thanks Roy  Looking forward to spending the day with my family  Also looking forward to a "tryptophan comma"  Happy Thanksgiving to all that will be celebrating
Thanks Roy.  What a treat to jump to the board and find Roy and Phil on the same thread.  You guys have a great day.
Sometimes you have to love "Old School" Connie
Yepp - Happy Thanksgiving Guys.  Enjoy the day out of the office with family and friends... hopefully some of you can get out fishing or hunting!  Cheers, Ryan
Very Happy Thanksgiving to all of our US buddies. Have a wonderful day. Hope all y'all get to stay away from the retail madness on Friday!
hopefully our American friends "get stuffed"
Ahh feasting all day while watching football.  One thing I miss in moving here from the states.  Cheers and have some extra stuffing!

Thanks Boys.............i should be spending the day relaxed and eating my face off. And of course thankin the big guy for everything ive got. And friday off as well means a day on the water........or at least thats the plan right now
Enjoy you Southern Gentlemen and your families!! You too Glen !!

Enjoy your families.  My wife, her sister, her mother and her aunt will be doing their best to boost your economy on Friday. Anybody between Barrie, Ontario and Grove City, Pennsylvania be on the look-out for a blue, late model CRV. Do not approach these women, they are armed with enough credit cards and discount coupons to do serious damage to anybody in their way.   Me? Four days of Yankee and Canadian football and all the chili I can eat! I love this holiday too.

Thank ya folks.   Actually Patsy and I are not having a Thanksgiving dinner this year.  Our church offers a FREE Thanksgiving Day meal with all the trimmings to the community as an outreach event.  We're providing a good hot meal to those who otherwise may not get one or those who have no familiy coming in or any place to go.  We even deliver meals to those in the community who are shut-in or otherwise cannot get out.   You'd be surprised how many of your (our) own neighbors have little to eat - or what they may be eating that day.   It's a great time and that's how we'll be spending Thankgiving Day.
thanks roy i will have a great day good food and football thanks to all
Have a Great Day Y'ALL...
May you all, our American  friends and pals, enjoy your day of thanks with friends and most of all, family.
Norm,did ya have a nip today?LOL
Who?...Me ?...Never !!!
have a great one!!
My gawd,that sure is a look alike of dawg ,if I ever seen one.Head master of the table and all. LOL   Just check,n.
thanks all, im gonna deep fry a bird for lunch with my parents then hang a tree stand or two and head to the inlaws to deep fry another bird for supper.  turkey overdose.  jason
Thanks all for the well wishes. I am indeed happy to be celebrating this holiday with family and we are thankful for the friends we have on both sides of the boarder.   Art

hahaha that's funny dude!  My wife, mother in-law, wife's aunts, cousins, I  think there's a whole CONVOY of cars headin' down this afernoon for a weekend of shopping insanity!  ME? left alone with my 3 year old girl and 7 month old boy.  I might take them on a cross province tackle shopping spree.
Thanx guys,I have two gobblers in the oven as as I sit here. Joe
yeah, happy thanksgiving eh'

GOD BLESS THE USA I can't stand all the America-bashing around the world these days...but it really pisses me off when it comes from Canadians! Anti-American bashing by Canadians is so moronic when you actually understand that this continent is more integrated than any other place on the planet... and there's nothing wrong with that... we are the beneficiaries...we're bashing ourselves when we bash Americans...  He's to manifest destiny!  All together now...  While the storm clouds gather far across the sea, Let us swear allegiance to a land that's free, Let us all be grateful for a land so fair, As we raise our voices in a solemn prayer.
